intro: Saponaria segetalis, commonly known as the field hellebore, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and clusters of blue or purple flowers. The plant produces a milky sap that contains saponins, which can be irritating to the skin. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a waxy coating, and it thrives in well-drained soils in full sun. Saponaria segetalis is often found in meadows and along roadsides, and it has historical uses in traditional medicine.
